body.p: To His Excellency Thomas E Bramlett Govenor of Kentucky

The undersigned petitioners would respectfully represent that on the 3rd day of May 1864 a judgment was rendered against J P Israel and Nathan Adams before Samuel Short Eqr. then Judge of the County Court of Lawrence County for Sixty dollars Each that at the time of its rendition Smiley Stewart went there Security in a bond for the payment of the same and at that time he could have indemnified himself out of the property of the parties but Govenor Magoffin respited the fine for one year and before that year had elapsed the property of the principals had been wasted or removed from the State and one of the parties had also left the Judgment was left to sleep untill lately and now the Security will be compelled to pay the whole amount and will not be able to get the Least indemnity as one of the parties has
left the county the other is in the United States army and there is no property with which he can be indemnified the security is a poor man in straightened circumstances and if compell to pay this judgment it will be ruinious to him in tender consideration of the premises we pray your excellency to remit the fine

J. W. Haws P. L. C. C
John N Allison S S C
Henry Meek Dep L. L. C.
Thomas Wallace.
S Short
